gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: Wage Glider - CTD from the MAGI project

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration - Southwest Fisheries Science Center

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Honey Badger Wave Glider CTD Data Dataset Description: <p>These&nbsp;data from the Sea-Bird Glider Payload CTD (GPCTD)&nbsp; include&nbsp;latitude, longitude, temperature, pressure, conductivity, and salinity&nbsp;along the&nbsp;AUV Honey Badger (Wave Glider model V2) trackline in the Pacific Northwest. &nbsp;</p><p>For more information on project MAGI and a description of Honey Badger,&nbsp;see:&nbsp;<a href="http://oceanview.pfeg.noaa.gov/MAGI/">http://oceanview.pfeg.noaa.gov/MAGI/</a></p> Acquisition Description: <p>The AUV Honey Badger&nbsp;is a Wave GliderÂ® (model SV2)&nbsp;from Liquid Robotics. &nbsp;It was&nbsp;deployed from the Island of Hawai'i in May of 2015 as&nbsp;part of Mesoscale Features Aggregate Interactions (MAGI) project&nbsp;. These data from the GPCTD were collected near-surface along the&nbsp;trackline is&nbsp;in the&nbsp;North Pacific Ocean and passes the ocean time-series station ALOHA.&nbsp;</p><p>For more information on project MAGI and a description of Honey Badger,&nbsp;see:&nbsp;<a href="http://oceanview.pfeg.noaa.gov/MAGI/" style="box-sizing: border-box; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; color: rgb(0, 102, 153); text-decoration: none; border: 0px; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit; font-family: inherit; vertical-align: baseline; background-color: transparent;">http://oceanview.pfeg.noaa.gov/MAGI/</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Division of Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-1430048 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward?AWD_ID=1430048

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: Long Duration AUVs as tools to explore Mesoscale feature aggregate interactions (MAGI)

gmd:name.gmx:Anchor: Long Duration AUVs as tools to explore Mesoscale feature aggregate interactions (MAGI)

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Description from NSF award abstract:Remote areas of the ocean are difficult to sample for short-lived or episodic features. This project will use a new sampling platform, the Wave Glider, and provide a continuous presence in the central North Pacific gyre. The six month duration of the mission will allow repeated sampling as well as spatial coverage previously unavailable. This mission will incorporate phytoplankton specific sensors as well as a set of optical sensors that will provide information on distribution, physiology and aggregation of a unique diatom-nitrogen fixing cyanobacterium symbiosis. When completed, this program will have generated the first data sets that follow these diatom blooms over extended periods in the region. Access to this instrumentation was facilitated by the PacX challenge, an international competition to produce high quality research from long-duration autonomous vehicles in the North and South Pacific Ocean. As a result of winning that competition, the principal investigator has been awarded the use of 6 months of the Honey Badger Wave Glider time in 2014. The Wave Glider is a wave-powered surface vessel capable of extended duration missions. In order to maximize this the principal investigator will outfit the glider with advanced sensors to quantify zones of intense diatom activity and aggregation along mesoscale features in the Pacific (Project MAGI: Mesoscale feature-AGregate Interactions).Note: This project is funded by an NSF RAPID award.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/654067.rdf Name: ISO_DateTime_UTC Units: unitless Description: Time (UTC) in format YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/654068.rdf Name: lat Units: decimal degrees Description: Latitude http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/654069.rdf Name: lon Units: decimal degrees Description: Longitude; west is negative http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/654070.rdf Name: temp Units: degrees Celcius Description: Temperature http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/654071.rdf Name: press Units: decibars Description: Pressure http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/654072.rdf Name: cond Units: Siemens per meter Description: Conductivity http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/654073.rdf Name: O2_uncal Units: unknown Description: Dissolved Oxygen (uncalibrated) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/654074.rdf Name: sal Units: practical salinity units Description: Salinity

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: GB/NERC/BODC > British Oceanographic Data Centre, Natural Environment Research Council, United Kingdom

gmd:citedResponsibleParty.xlink:title: GB/NERC/BODC > British Oceanographic Data Centre, Natural Environment Research Council, United Kingdom

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/DTUT8601/ Name: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision) Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z' http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/TEMPP901/ Name: Temperature (ITS-90) of the water body Description: The degree of hotness at any position within a volume of fresh or salt water expressed against the International Temperature Scale 1990 (ITS-90) calibration standard. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/PRESPR01/ Name: Pressure (spatial co-ordinate) exerted by the water body by profiling pressure sensor and corrected to read zero at sea level Description: The force per unit area exerted by the water column on a mobile sensor located in the water column. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/CNDC/ Name: Electrical conductivity of the water column Description: Parameters quantifying the flow of electrical current through or the electrical resistance of a body of water at any point between the bed and the atmosphere http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/PSALST01/ Name: Practical salinity of the water body by CTD and computation using UNESCO 1983 algorithm Description: This is the preferred term for this definition. Alternative term PSALST02 is included to cover cases where there are two sensors of the same type contributing to the data set and referential integrity considerations prevent a usage of a single code.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Time (UTC) in format YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z; General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

PI-supplied Description: Latitude; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude; west is negative; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Temperature; General Description: water temperature at measurement depth NERC Description: The degree of hotness at any position within a volume of fresh or salt water expressed against the International Temperature Scale 1990 (ITS-90) calibration standard.

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Pressure (spatial co-ordinate) exerted by the water body by profiling pressure sensor and corrected to read zero at sea level

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Pressure; General Description: water pressure at measurement; depth reported as pressure; positive number increasing with water depth NERC Description: The force per unit area exerted by the water column on a mobile sensor located in the water column.

gmd:sequenceIdentifier.xlink:title: conductivity from the CTD primary sensor

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Electrical conductivity of the water column

gco:aName.gco:CharacterString: conductivity from the CTD primary sensor

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Conductivity; General Description: conductivity, from the CTD 'primary sensor', usually reported in Siemens/meter. Depending on input source may have a variety of names. NERC Description: Parameters quantifying the flow of electrical current through or the electrical resistance of a body of water at any point between the bed and the atmosphere
PI-supplied Description: Dissolved Oxygen (uncalibrated); General Description: dissolved oxygen concentration not calibrated with oxygen water samples analyzed with Winkler titration method

gmd:sequenceIdentifier.xlink:title: salinity calculated from CTD primary sensors

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Practical salinity of the water body by CTD and computation using UNESCO 1983 algorithm

gco:aName.gco:CharacterString: salinity calculated from CTD primary sensors

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Salinity; General Description: salinity, calculated from the CTD 'primary sensors' of conductivity and temperature, Practical Salinity Scale (PSS-78), dimensionless. Depending on the input source, salinity from the primary sensors can have a variety of names i.e. s0, s00, sal0, sal00. NERC Description: This is the preferred term for this definition. Alternative term PSALST02 is included to cover cases where there are two sensors of the same type contributing to the data set and referential integrity considerations prevent a usage of a single code.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p>The AUV Honey Badger&nbsp;is a Wave GliderÂ® (model SV2)&nbsp;from Liquid Robotics. &nbsp;It was&nbsp;deployed from the Island of Hawai'i in May of 2015 as&nbsp;part of Mesoscale Features Aggregate Interactions (MAGI) project&nbsp;. These data from the GPCTD were collected near-surface along the&nbsp;trackline is&nbsp;in the&nbsp;North Pacific Ocean and passes the ocean time-series station ALOHA.&nbsp;</p><p>For more information on project MAGI and a description of Honey Badger,&nbsp;see:&nbsp;<a href="http://oceanview.pfeg.noaa.gov/MAGI/" style="box-sizing: border-box; margin: 0px; padding: 0px; color: rgb(0, 102, 153); text-decoration: none; border: 0px; font-style: inherit; font-variant: inherit; font-weight: inherit; font-stretch: inherit; font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit; font-family: inherit; vertical-align: baseline; background-color: transparent;">http://oceanview.pfeg.noaa.gov/MAGI/</a></p><p>&nbsp;</p>

<p>These data are&nbsp;raw telemetry data obtained through the Wave Glider management system at Liquid Robotics, International.</p><p>For more information about this softare please see the Liquid Robotics Software Page:</p><p><a href="http://www.liquid-robotics.com/platform/software/">http://www.liquid-robotics.com/platform/software/</a></p><p>DMO notes:</p><ul><li>Latitude and longitude were rounded to 5 decimal places from 12.</li><li>Values of "NaN" and "nan" changed to "nd"</li></ul>

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: GPCTD Instrument Name: Sea-Bird Glider Payload CTD Instrument Short Name:GPCTD Instrument Description: The GPCTD is a modular instrument for autonomous gliders.  For more information see: http://www.seabird.com/glider-payload-ctd
